error.signature: Error: The run was canceled because a higher priority run was queued. Concurrency group: ci-main
error.regex: (?:canceled.*concurrency|cancelled.*concurrency group|superseded by|This workflow was cancelled|canceled because a higher priority run)

verdict.summary: A GitHub Actions workflow run is cancelled because a newer commit to the same branch triggers another run in the same concurrency group. The cancel-in-progress setting supersedes the older run.

dead_ends.why_fails: Without concurrency controls, multiple runs pile up consuming runner resources and potentially deploying out of order

dead_ends.action: Set a unique concurrency group per run using run_id
dead_ends.why_fails: Using a unique key per run effectively disables concurrency control, defeating its purpose entirely

workarounds.action: Use branch-aware concurrency groups with cancel-in-progress only for non-default branches
workarounds.how: Set 'concurrency: group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}' with 'cancel-in-progress: ${{ github.ref != 'refs/heads/main' }}' to only cancel in-progress runs on feature branches

workarounds.action: Disable cancel-in-progress and let jobs queue instead
workarounds.how: Set 'cancel-in-progress: false' in the concurrency block so that newer runs wait for the current run to complete instead of cancelling it

leads_to.condition: When a deployment run is cancelled mid-deploy, leaving infrastructure in an inconsistent state

preceded_by.condition: When rapid fix-push-fix cycles for syntax errors trigger multiple concurrent runs

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Concurrency cancelled means a newer run superseded this one; timeout means the job ran too long
